data.text: @JackiesBrother @Garrett_Archer @AZDHS I'm sure that's all a coincidence...  /s

@AndyfromTucson @Garrett_Archer @AZDHS Is it just me or is making it confusing & worse just part of the plan by @AZDHS / @dougducey?

(I think I can guess the answer btw)

@Garrett_Archer @AZDHS It's messy as heck to do it this way, since the last bar is plainly labeled as an average if you hover over it.

They should either go back to reporting by day, but only update once a week, or if they are going to report Tuesdays, just make the chart the census on each Tuesday.
@Garrett_Archer @AZDHS Any insight on why the census decline stalled out? HHS/CDC hospital admission data suggests admissions are still falling at a rapid clip.

@willhumble_az There is no delay in "Hospital COVID-19 Specific Metrics", but it will be only reflect what happened in the hospitals on Tuesday.

There is a two week delay of the "hospitalization" epi dashboard. https://t.co/Rm3oEtNlrx
@Garrett_Archer So are the hospital metrics on a 1-week or 2-week delay?
@MaverickLiz @Garrett_Archer @AZDHS all the states that allowed thousands to die over political posturing seem to have confusing, delayed, skewed, exaggerated or non-existent reporting.
@Garrett_Archer @AZDHS Very confusing way to report. So basically, the hospital numbers are now lagged, too?
